net.jenet

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jenet.Packet

  • public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
    Wraps information to be sent through JeNet.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.nio.ByteBuffer data 
      protected int dataLength 
      static int FLAG_RELIABLE
      Indicates that this packet is reliable
      static int FLAG_UNSEQUENCED
      Indicates that the packet should be processed no matter its order relative to other packets.
      protected int flags 
      protected int referenceCount

    • Constructor Detail

      • Packet

        public Packet(int dataLength,
      int flags)
        Creates a new Packet. The constructor allocates a new packet and allocates a buffer of dataLength bytes for it.
        Parameters:
        dataLength - The size in bytes of this packet.
        flags - An byte inidicating the how to handle this packet.

        public void toBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
            int offset,
            int length)
        Copies part of this packet's data into the given buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Destination buffer
        offset - Initial position of the destination buffer
        length - Total number of bytes to copy

      • fromBuffer

        Copies the given buffer into this packet's data.

      • fromBuffer

        public void fromBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
              int fragmentOffset,
              int length)
        Copies part of the given buffer into this packet's data.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to copy from
        fragmentOffset - Position of the first byte to copy
        length - Total number of bytes to copy

      • getFlags

        public int getFlags()
        Returns this packet's flags.
        Returns:
        Returns the flags.

      • setFlags

        public void setFlags(int flags)
        Sets the flags for this packet. The parameter is an or of the flags FLAG_RELIABLE and FLAG_UNSEQUENCED a value of zero indicates an unreliable, sequenced (last one is kept) packet.
        Parameters:
        flags - The flags to set.
